required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Serum Level of Bioactive Mediators and Urinary Biopyrins in Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: Serum Level of Bioactive Mediators and Urinary Biopyrins in Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock:
1. Assess the level of lipid mediators in patients with psoriasis
2. Assess the urinary level of biopyrins as New marker of oxidative stress in patients with psoriasis
3. Correlate the serum level of bioactive lipid mediators and urinary level of biopyrins with Psoriasis Area and Severity Index

detailed_description.textblock: Psoriasis is acommon immune mediated inflammatory skin disorder of complex pathomechanisms which is generically conditioned and influenced by environmental factors

primary_outcome.measure: the serum level of bioactive lipid mediators in patients with psoriasis
primary_outcome.description: Bioactive lipid mediators (LMs) are potent compounds reported to play a role in the development and resolution of inflammation.

intervention.description: Assess bioactive lipid mediators in blood and biopyrins in urine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age from12 to 80 and both sex
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with other dermatological disorders

reference.citation: Sorokin AV, Domenichiello AF, Dey AK, Yuan ZX, Goyal A, Rose SM, Playford MP, Ramsden CE, Mehta NN. Bioactive Lipid Mediator Profiles in Human Psoriasis Skin and Blood. J Invest Dermatol. 2018 Jul;138(7):1518-1528. doi: 10.1016/j.jid.2018.02.003. Epub 2018 Feb 15.
Bakry OA, El Hefnawy S, Mariee AH, El Gendy Y. Urinary Biopyrrins: A New Marker of Oxidative Stress in Psoriasis. Indian J Dermatol. 2016 Mar-Apr;61(2):169-73. doi: 10.4103/0019-5154.177756.
